injuries.shortComment: Martin has been placed in the league's health and safety protocols and is out for Friday's contest against the Bulls.
injuries.longComment: The wing is now the fifth Pacers' player to be placed in the league's health and safety protocols. The likes of Justin Holiday, Torrey Craig and Oshae Brissett emerge as candidates for usage with Martin sidelined. The Pacers are slated to play four contests over the next seven days.

injuries.shortComment: Duarte was placed in the league's COVID-19 protocols Thursday, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: After Jeremy Lamb entered protocols Wednesday, the Pacers added Duarte, Brogdon and Isaiah Jackson to the list Thursday morning. Duarte figures to miss at least the next six days, effectively ruling him out for at least Indiana's next three contests, beginning with Friday's game against Chicago.

injuries.shortComment: Brogdon (Achilles) entered COVID-19 protocols Thursday, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: Brogdon has missed the past three games due to an Achilles injury but will now be sidelined due to protocols. Chris Duarte, Isaiah Jackson and Jeremy Lamb also entered protocols Thursday. Keifer Sykes and Duane Washington could enter the rotation as a result.

injuries.shortComment: Lamb entered COVID-19 protocols Wednesday,  Tony East of Locked On Pacers reports.
injuries.longComment: Lamb becomes the latest player to test positive for the virus, so he'll likely need to quarantine for at least six days before potentially returning to the team. As such, Lamb should be expected to miss the next three games, at minimum.

injuries.shortComment: McConnell underwent surgery Tuesday to repair a torn ligament in his right wrist and is expected to miss several months, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: McConnell was initially diagnosed with right wrist soreness after exiting the Pacers' Dec. 1 game against the Hawks, only for head coach Rick Carlisle to acknowledge two days later that the point guard was sporting a cast and on track to miss multiple weeks. With further tests detecting ligament damage in his wrist, McConnell was forced to go under the knife to address the injury. With McConnell seemingly at risk until being sidelined around the All-Star break, he's tough to justify holding outside of deeper redraft leagues. Brad Wanamaker will likely be locked in as the Pacers' backup point guard behind starter Malcolm Brogdon for the duration of McConnell's absence.

injuries.shortComment: Warren (foot) was spotted taking part in shooting drills during Sunday's practice, Tony East of the West Indianapolis Community News reports. "It's huge for team morale, it's huge for him," teammate Caris LeVert said of Warren's presence at practice. "He's had a long journey back, and we can't wait for him to continue to get healthy."
injuries.longComment: Warren has remained out of commission since Dec. 29, 2020 after developing a stress fracture in his left foot that later required surgery. Though the Pacers were optimistic that Warren would be ready to go for the start of the regular season, he was still donning a walking boot in training camp, making it clear his absence would stretch deep into the campaign. The team has yet to provide an official timeline for Warren to make his 2021-22 debut, though more clarity on that front could come when he undergoes additional scans on his foot later this month or in early January. Even if the scans bring good news, Warren will still likely require multiple weeks of ramp-up and conditioning work before he's ready to play in games.
